title: Fake News: Saudi Arabia NOT To Increase Oil Prices 5 Times Starting Tomorrow | Lead Stories
subtitle: Will oil prices from Saudi Arabia increase fivefold tomorrow after the loss against Russia today at the World Cup with...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Will oil prices from Saudi Arabia increase fivefold tomorrow after the loss against Russia today at the World Cup with an embarrassing 5 - 0 score? No, that's not true: the story was published by a well known "fauxtire" site (a combination between "faux" and "satire"). It is not real, oil prices don't work that way.

The story originated from an article published by 8Shit on June 14, 2018 titled "Saudi Arabia To Increase Oil Prices "5 Times", Starting Tomorrow" (archived here) which opened:

Following today's match with Russia, the King of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman, has announced a slight increase in oil prices, starting tomorrow. After losing 5 - 0 against Russia, Saudi Arabia will increase the price at which they sell oil, 5 times. "This is an important decision, especially for those who are making memes about us right now. They are the ones who will feel the pressure", said Salman, very angered in a press conference. "We can't be made fun of", he said.

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail and might have driven to the pump to fill up:

Following today's match with Russia, the King of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman, has announced a slight increase in oil prices, starting tomorrow. After losing 5 - 0 against Russia, Saudi Arabia will increase the price at which they sell oil, 5 times. "This is an important decision, especially for those who are making memes about [...]

But 8shit.net carries a disclaimer on its about page that reads:

And an additional disclaimer in the footer of every page:

8Shit is a satire news and humor website. All its content is fiction (except those posts under the "serious" category) and shouldn't be taken as real. All references, names and marks or institutions in this website are used as contextual elements, like in any novel or science-fiction story.
